entry.et: Medieval Latin cultivatus, past participle of cultivare, from cultivus cultivable, from Latin cultus, past participle of colere

def.dt: :to prepare or prepare and use for the raising of crops
:to loosen or break up the soil about (growing plants)
:to foster the growth of cultivate vegetables
:to improve by labor, care, or study :refine cultivate the mind
:to seek the society of :make friends with
